issue.body:

AdGuard Base

Filter unblocking search ads and self-promotion

comment.body:
AdGuard는 관련 없는 이슈 같습니다.
RemoveAdblockThing 유져스크립트를 제거해주세요.
https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/commit/d0370b5cc1fa5b4d741eebf45a93288bace260b9

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > I don't follow these things and in the past, they didn't show with AdGuard enabled, but these days, it's more of this than content I want to see. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ntzawvhc36s004c8cwwwokwk0c0swg4tsaqy36qw40.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/usmqbszp4dwc0skkos4s8ccwwk004kobfe0gopuxw4.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Windows v7.17.1 (4709) System version: | Windows 10 22H2 Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard driver: | WFP Stealth mode options: | Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,
Hide your Referrer from third-parties,
Hide your User-Agent,
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests,
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Disable cache for third-party requests,
Block trackers,
Disable Windows Telemetry,
Turn off Advertising ID DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard`, `DNS`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/windows/filters/15.txt`, `User rules` Filters: | Ad Blocking:

Userscripts: | https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/release/popup-blocker/2.5/popupblocker.user.js Other extensions used: | Way too much garbage on Facebook and Twitter these days that doesn't get filtered, which used to be filtered in the past. It kind of makes me regret paying for your software, since it no longer does what I bought it for. ### Import issue configuration (AdGuard for Windows) [Import](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=adguard%3Aimport_user_configuration%3F%3Fbrowsing_security.enabled%3Dtrue%26browsing_security.statistics_enabled%3Dfalse%26dns.custom_bootstrap%3D%26dns.custom_fallback%3D%26dns.enabled%3Dtrue%26dns.fallback_mode%3DSystem%26dns.filters%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Ffilters.adtidy.org%252Fwindows%252Ffilters%252F15.txt%252CUser%2Brules%26dns.filters_enabled%3Dtrue%26dns.servers%3DSystem%26dns.timeout%3D0%26filters%3D109.202.225.227.233.243.249.253.13.16.17.1.224.2.3.6.7.8%26license_type%3Dpaid%26parental_control.enabled%3Dfalse%26product_type%3DWin%26product_version%3D7.17.1%2B%25284709%2529%26referrer%3D%26stealth.DNT%3Dtrue%26stealth.block_third_party_auth%3Dfalse%26stealth.block_trackers%3Dtrue%26stealth.disable_third_party_cache%3Dtrue%26stealth.disable_wap_push_message_routing_service%3Dfalse%26stealth.disable_windows_defender%3Dfalse%26stealth.disable_windows_telemetry%3Dtrue%26stealth.dpi%3Dfalse%26stealth.enabled%3Dtrue%26stealth.flash%3Dfalse%26stealth.hide_search_queries%3Dtrue%26stealth.java%3Dfalse%26stealth.location%3Dfalse%26stealth.push%3Dfalse%26stealth.strip_url%3Dtrue%26stealth.third_party_cookies%3D180%26stealth.turn_off_advertising_id%3Dtrue%26stealth.webrtc%3Dfalse%26stealth.x_client%3Dtrue%26url%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fadguard.com%252Fen%252Fwelcome.html%26user_agent%3DMozilla%252F5.0%2B%2528Windows%2BNT%2B10.0%253B%2BWin64%253B%2Bx64%2529%2BAppleWebKit%252F537.36%2B%2528KHTML%252C%2Blike%2BGecko%2529%2BChrome%252F124.0.0.0%2BSafari%252F537.36%26userscripts%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fadguard-extra%252F1.0%252Fadguard-extra.user.js%252Chttps%253A%252F%252Fuserscripts.adtidy.org%252Frelease%252Fpopup-blocker%252F2.5%252Fpopupblocker.user.js%26win.wfp%3Dtrue)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/172033

> Yes, I know, and it would be helpful, because we received a report of TikTok ads too but none of us can reproduce it. It is ok if you don't want to. By the way, I don't know if this converted filter above is valid.

yes that's correct. I haven't found any more ads when scrolling on TikTok after installing that rule
whether the rule still needs to be researched further or not, what is certain is that I am sure this rule will help other people in the future by including it in the Adguard filter
